findings.title: DiagonalServiceBeacon.sol: Anyone can upgrade the contract
findings.description: The `upgradeTo` method in the `DiagonalServiceBeacon` contract is missing validation to check who is calling the contract, allowing anyone to call this method to upgrade the contract code.

findings.title: DiagonalServiceV1.sol: After updated callback can be called by anyone
findings.description: The `afterAgreementUpdated` method in the `DiagonalServiceV1` contract is missing validation to check who is calling the contract, allowing anyone to call it instead of restricting it to the `SuperFluid` host.

findings.title: Missing input validations
findings.description: The contracts are missing input validations on several methods which is generally recommended to avoid any unexpected fund loss.

findings.title: _removePackageId method will not work in all cases
findings.description: The _removePackageId method removes the first element if no packageId match is found during the search, which is not a valid implementation for removing an element from an array.

findings.title: Revert vs return during iteration
findings.description: In some cases, contracts revert if one validation fails in a `for` loop, which can revert the whole transaction and fail to commit any operation that has happened before.

findings.title: Custom upgradable contract patterns may be risky
findings.description: The custom implementation of upgradable contracts lacks validations present in OpenZeppelin libraries, such as code length validation before deployment.

findings.title: Miscellaneous code cleanup
findings.description: Code cleanup comments to improve the readability of the overall code.

findings.title: Validate the hardcoded addresses before deploying
findings.description: There are several addresses hardcoded in the contracts and it is recommended to verify them before deploying the contracts.

findings.title: DiagonalServiceManagementV1.sol: addPackage() function includes costly operations
findings.description: The `addPackage()` function in the `DiagonalServiceManagementV1.sol` contract includes costly **_for_** loop operations, which rely on an arbitrary number of total packages being passed as an argument and include external calls in every iteration.

findings.title: Dependency on SuperFluid
findings.description: Consider minimizing the reliance on SuperFluid to reduce the app from being exposed by exploits in SuperFluid.
